data.title: Let's Preview Every Single NBA Game! (Yes, All 1312)
data.meta_description: Thirty teams. Eighty-two games each. One thousand three hundred and twelve games total. And it all starts tonight. Welcome to the one and only preview of every single one of them.
data.text:
Thirty teams. Eighty-two games each. One thousand three hundred and twelve games total. And it all starts tonight. Welcome to the one and only preview of every single one of them.

OCTOBER

**10/27/15 **

Detroit Pistons at Atlanta Hawks: Paul Millsap loses his iPhone.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Chicago Bulls: LeBron James notches a triple-double in the first half.

New Orleans Pelicans at Golden State Warriors: The NBA's most futuristic team clashes with its most futuristic player. You'll never guess what happens next.

10/28/15

Philadelphia 76ers at Boston Celtics: Obviously, Jahlil Okafor suffers a season-ending injury.

Chicago Bulls at Brooklyn Nets: Joe Johnson and Jimmy Butler have a blank-stare contest.

Utah Jazz at Detroit Pistons: Rudy Gobert and Andre Drummond high-five before the game, and a statue is immediately commissioned.

Denver Nuggets at Houston Rockets: Terrence Jones: Yet another Houston Rocket you will come to grudgingly respect.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers: Julius Randle texts Jahlil Okafor.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Memphis Grizzlies: Tony Allen starts speaking in tongues, dribbles the ball off of his foot.

Charlotte Hornets at Miami Heat: Goran Dragic and Chris Bosh continue to bond over their shared love of Spice 1.

New York Knicks at Milwaukee Bucks: Milwaukee fan crafts award-winning "Knicks Could Be Bucks but You Playing" sign.

San Antonio Spurs at Oklahoma City Thunder: Bill Walton refers to Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook as "a binary star system."

Washington Wizards at Orlando Magic: The Harry Potter Classic comes down to the wire!

Dallas Mavericks at Phoenix Suns: Eric Bledsoe and Brandon Knight finally get to meet in person.

New Orleans Pelicans at Portland Trail Blazers: Moe Harkless is the first big fantasy-basketball story of 2015-16.

Los Angeles Clippers at Sacramento Kings: One game in, "DMC for MVP" is too catchy to resist.

Indiana Pacers at Toronto Raptors: The Paul George point-guard experiment commences.

10/29/15

Memphis Grizzlies at Indiana Pacers: The Grizzlies refer to Conseco Field House as "hallowed ground."

Dallas Mavericks at Los Angeles Clippers: Chandler Parsons has memorized every Liz Phair song for the occasion.

Atlanta Hawks at New York Knicks: No one cares about Carmelo Anthony's new hat.

10/30/15

Charlotte Hornets at Atlanta Hawks: Kemba Walker really gets a chance to prove himself against All-Star Jeff Teague.

Toronto Raptors at Boston Celtics: The Celtics clinch a playoff spot in the East.

Miami Heat at Cleveland Cavaliers: LeBron James dedicates the win to his former teammates.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Denver Nuggets: Rocky the Mountain Lion breaks his silence.

Chicago Bulls at Detroit Pistons: A very poised Brandon Jennings apologizes to the country for that 55-point game.

Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets: Draymond Green threatens to "face-scalp" James Harden in the paint.

Washington Wizards at Milwaukee Bucks: Giannis Antetokounmpo blocks a shot, dunks at the other end without dribbling.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Orlando Magic: Tobias Harris definitely took some acting classes in the off-season.

Utah Jazz at Philadelphia 76ers : "Only through darkness and suffering can man arrive at true fulfillment."—Sam Hinkie

Portland Trail Blazers at Phoenix Suns: Damian Lillard hits a game-winner. Moral victory abounds.

Los Angeles Lakers at Sacramento Kings: Kobe Bryant announces that he's going to "sequester DeMarcus Cousins in the torture chamber."

Brooklyn Nets at San Antonio Spurs: Several members of the Spurs are questioned as part of the investigation into a big-game poaching ring.

10/31/15

Utah Jazz at Indiana Pacers: Headline writer dies and goes to hell when Jordan Hill, George Hill, and Solomon Hill all shine.

Sacramento Kings at Los Angeles Clippers:"You some kind of cartoon character?"—Rajon Rondo to Willie Cauley-Stein

Brooklyn Nets at Memphis Grizzlies: Jarrett Jack joins a cult.

Golden State Warriors at New Orleans Pelicans: Everyone looks the other way as Anthony Davis experiments with facial hair.

Phoenix Suns at Portland Trail Blazers: A mother tells her child a white lie: Nicolas Batum is dead.

New York Knicks at Washington Wizards: Fun fact: Bradley Beal has never played at Madison Square Garden.

NOVEMBER

11/1/15

San Antonio Spurs at Boston Celtics: Tommy Heinsohn tries to claim credit for the Spurs' long run of excellence since the Celtics invented being good at basketball.

Orlando Magic at Chicago Bulls: Kirk Hinrich plays in a pair of Stan Smiths, immediately gets huge in Beirut.

Atlanta Hawks at Charlotte Hornets: Thabo Sefolosha can finally relax.

Dallas Mavericks at Los Angeles Lakers: After some good Lakers wins and real chemistry on the court, Nick Young has to do some real soul-searching.

Houston Rockets at Miami Heat: If the Heat win this one, they're a force to be reckoned with in the postseason.

Denver Nuggets at Oklahoma City Thunder: Westbrook and Durant alternate 30 points quarters before falling asleep in each other's arms.

Milwaukee Bucks at Toronto Raptors: Bucks win!

Milwaukee Bucks at Brooklyn Nets: Bucks win again!

Memphis Grizzlies at Golden State Warriors: Steve Kerr asks pointed questions in the press about the real Marc Gasol.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Houston Rockets: Russell Westbrook literally decapitates Ty Lawson.

Phoenix Suns at Los Angeles Clippers: Next time, Archie Goodwin. Next time.

Portland Trail Blazers at Minnesota Timberwolves: The Minnesota Timberwolves are the most exciting young team in basketball.

San Antonio Spurs at New York Knicks: James Dolan tries to abduct Gregg Popovich.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Philadelphia 76ers: Dan Gilbert accuses the Sixers of filling out their roster with the names of long-deceased Philadelphians.

11/3/15

Chicago Bulls at Charlotte Hornets: That game some of us need to be reminded that Al Jefferson exists.

Toronto Raptors at Dallas Mavericks: Very religious and partially deaf Mavs fan feels like maybe he should be pulling for "The Rapture."

Indiana Pacers at Detroit Pistons: The Pistons and Pacers finally agree to use The Brawl as a marketing ploy.

Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Lakers: Kenneth Faried tries out for the Entourage sequel.

Atlanta Hawks at Miami Heat: At this very moment, these are the two best teams in the East.

Orlando Magic at New Orleans Pelicans: The Eddie Bo bobblehead is a rousing success.

Memphis Grizzlies at Sacramento Kings: DeMarcus Cousins and Zach Randolph have a good laugh during warm-ups.

11/4/15

Brooklyn Nets at Atlanta Hawks: Bojan Bogdanovic decries white slavery.

New York Knicks at Cleveland Cavaliers: Cleanthony Early and Langston Galloway have an important disagreement.

Los Angeles Clippers at Golden State Warriors: The Clippers remind us why their team name reeks of self-undermining behavior.

Orlando Magic at Houston Rockets: Elfrid Payton's hair suffers a total collapse, but he's doing just fine.

Boston Celtics at Indiana Pacers: Larry Bird throws out the first pitch.

Philadelphia 76ers at Milwaukee Bucks: Michael Carter-Williams is happy he was traded.

Toronto Raptors at Oklahoma City Thunder: Terrence Ross tips in a buzzer-beater with his armpit; Toronto press immediately dubs it "The Scaly Claw of the Most High Reptilian Overlord."

Sacramento Kings at Phoenix Suns: Killdozer reunites to play a set at halftime; P.J. Tucker is not amused.

Portland Trail Blazers at Utah Jazz: In street clothes, Dante Exum turns heel.

San Antonio Spurs at Washington Wizards: John Wall puts up big numbers in a blowout win, but who knows WTF the Spurs were thinking anyway.

**11/5/15 **

Oklahoma City Thunder at Chicago Bulls: Enes Kanter loses a bet, has to run out during introductions with a pancake on his head.

Charlotte Hornets at Dallas Mavericks: Deron Williams peels back the scab that has been his NBA existence for the past five years, gets a really cool triple-double.

Utah Jazz at Denver Nuggets: Rudy Gobert blocks 20 shots.

Miami Heat at Minnesota Timberwolves: Player-coach Kevin Garnett gets in a feisty battle with himself and ends up getting ejected twice.

Memphis Grizzlies at Portland Trail Blazers: Z-Bo Appreciation Night, because why not?

11/6/15

Washington Wizards at Boston Celtics: Evan Turner makes one too many puns.

Los Angeles Lakers at Brooklyn Nets: Kobe gives an interview about his favorite Brooklyn neighborhoods.

Philadelphia 76ers at Cleveland Cavaliers: Kyrie Irving makes a surprise return, plays limited minutes.

Denver Nuggets at Golden State Warriors: Klay Thompson warms up in a full-length mink, is fined for too much dress code.

Miami Heat at Indiana Pacers: Paul George starts at power forward for Miami.

Atlanta Hawks at New Orleans Pelicans: Hawks continue to roll as Anthony Davis is frustrated all night by Paul Millsap and Al Horford.

Milwaukee Bucks at New York Knicks: Knick if you Buck.

Toronto Raptors at Orlando Magic: Kyle Lowry slam-dances his way to victory.

Detroit Pistons at Phoenix Suns: Ersan Ilyasova starts doing that thing where he's really good for three months.

Houston Rockets at Sacramento Kings: Rajon Rondo sets a booby trap for the headless Ty Lawson and electrocutes him twice.

11/7/15

Washington Wizards at Atlanta Hawks: The Wizards come close, but the Hawks are just too much for them.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Chicago Bulls: Nikola Mirotic refers to himself as "the broke man's Kevin Durant."

New Orleans Pelicans at Dallas Mavericks: Tyreke Evans goes to a high school–football game and never comes back.

Houston Rockets at Los Angeles Clippers: James Harden tells reporters that he's not from that L.A.

Brooklyn Nets at Milwaukee Bucks: Greg Monroe is suspended for Sudafed intake.

Orlando Magic at Philadelphia 76ers: Victor Oladipo goes 40, even though torching the Sixers is in poor taste.

Golden State Warriors at Sacramento Kings: Rudy Gay gets the giggles.

Charlotte Hornets at San Antonio Spurs: Big night for "The Lin and the Lamb."

Memphis Grizzlies at Utah Jazz: Gordon Hayward shows off his unique upper-body strength.

11/8/15

Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers: Everyone realizes that the Pacers were much better with Roy Hibbert, whoever that is.

Toronto Raptors at Miami Heat: James Johnson karate chops the backboard in half on an offensive rebound.

Los Angeles Lakers at New York Knicks: Robin Lopez catches some serious heat for his AMA.

Phoenix Suns at Oklahoma City Thunder: The Thunder's three-point shooters account for roughly half of their points.

Detroit Pistons at Portland Trail Blazers: Brandon Jennings and Reggie Jackson get really into Brian DePalma's Sisters.

11/9/15

Minnesota Timberwolves at Atlanta Hawks: Ricky Rubio sprains his ankle as part of an elaborate no-look touch pass.

Portland Trail Blazers at Denver Nuggets: Some Nuggets remind Z-Bo of his time with the Knicks and Clippers.

Detroit Pistons at Golden State Warriors: Draymond Green is accused of disrespecting the game.

Orlando Magic at Indiana Pacers: Nikola Vucevic gets two double-doubles.

Memphis Grizzlies at Los Angeles Clippers: Chris Paul gets physical.

Chicago Bulls at Philadelphia 76ers: The Bulls start their subs and bring the starters off the bench.

San Antonio Spurs at Sacramento Kings: Popovich tells the press that DeMarcus Cousins is his favorite center in the league.

11/10/15

Utah Jazz at Cleveland Cavaliers: Kevin Love gets a tattoo of a rainbow, and it really brings the team together.

Los Angeles Lakers at Miami Heat: Shaq is honored at halftime for his philanthropic efforts.

Boston Celtics at Milwaukee Bucks: The Bucks have better players, but the Celtics prove that they're the better team.

Charlotte Hornets at Minnesota Timberwolves: Zach LaVine has yet to dunk all season.

Dallas Mavericks at New Orleans Pelicans: Devin Harris puts the Smooth in Smoothie King.

New York Knicks at Toronto Raptors: The Knicks get the job done. As in, they lose.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Washington Wizards: Wall vs. Westbrook fails to disappoint.

11/11/15

New Orleans Pelicans at Atlanta Hawks: When birds collide, everyone walks away a little ruffled.

Indiana Pacers at Boston Celtics: Monta Ellis secretly enjoys being taken for granted.

New York Knicks at Charlotte Hornets: Kristaps Porzingis breaks out.

Los Angeles Clippers at Dallas Mavericks: DeAndre Jordan skips the game to practice his unicycling.

Milwaukee Bucks at Denver Nuggets: Khris Middleton lies about his age.

Brooklyn Nets at Houston Rockets: The Nets pretend they're tanking.

Golden State Warriors at Memphis Grizzlies: The Grizzlies shoot nothing but threes all night, crack themselves up, and lose by 30.

Los Angeles Lakers at Orlando Magic: Dwight Howard gossip rules the day.

Toronto Raptors at Philadelphia 76ers: Tony Wroten continues to put up huge numbers on a lousy team.

San Antonio Spurs at Portland Trail Blazers: LaMarcus Aldridge has his jersey prematurely retired.

Detroit Pistons at Sacramento Kings: Kentavious Caldwell-Pope to the rescue!

11/12/15

Utah Jazz at Miami Heat: Derrick Favors answers his critics.

Golden State Warriors at Minnesota Timberwolves: Stephen Curry and Ricky Rubio show off, and it's the most entertaining game of the season.

Los Angeles Clippers at Phoenix Suns: Are the Suns for real, or are the Clippers a fraud?

Atlanta Hawks at Boston Celtics: David Lee cracks the rotation.

Charlotte Hornets at Chicago Bulls: Derrick Rose gets really into #GamerGate.

Los Angeles Lakers at Dallas Mavericks: Jarrid Famous, even if you've been cut, you're always famous in my heart.

Houston Rockets at Denver Nuggets: The Rockets ask if the Nuggets have a spare Ty Lawson head lying around. Luckily, they do.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Indiana Pacers: Andre Miller admits he's sometimes been on three teams at once.

Portland Trail Blazers at Memphis Grizzlies: The Grizzlies decide to honor Portland's appreciation of Z-Bo by letting them take the lead in the third.

Cleveland Cavaliers at New York Knicks: Another magical performance at the Garden for LeBron James!

Philadelphia 76ers at Oklahoma City Thunder: Anthony Morrow won't stop calling Kyle Singler "dildo head."

Utah Jazz at Orlando Magic: Evan Fournier becomes the Allen Iverson of white baller hair.

Brooklyn Nets at Sacramento Kings: Several Nets hang out on the concourse during halftime.

New Orleans Pelicans at Toronto Raptors: Anthony Davis inches ahead of Stephen Curry in the MVP race.

11/14/15

Brooklyn Nets at Golden State Warriors: The Nets unveil their No Fear endorsement deal.

Dallas Mavericks at Houston Rockets: The Rockets show why the Warriors should be very afraid.

Detroit Pistons at Los Angeles Clippers: This one comes down to a hilarious offensive battle between Andre Drummond and DeAndre Jordan.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Milwaukee Bucks: Milwaukee has lots of weapons. Cleveland has the bomb.

Denver Nuggets at Phoenix Suns: The Nuggets seek asylum.

Philadelphia 76ers at San Antonio Spurs: I would give my left arm to hear a candid dialogue between Gregg Popovich and Sam Hinkie.

Orlando Magic at Washington Wizards: The Magic are gaining some steam, the Wizards are slumping a little...could be a good one.

11/15/15

Utah Jazz at Atlanta Hawks: Joke about race.

Portland Trail Blazers at Charlotte Hornets: Michael Kidd-Gilchrist is dying inside.

Detroit Pistons at Los Angeles Lakers: Kobe has never forgotten the Pistons, shoots 75 times just to let you know.

Memphis Grizzlies at Minnesota Timberwolves: This game is decided by an actual wolf and bear hacking each other to shreds at center court.

New Orleans Pelicans at New York Knicks: Knicks fans don't realize how good Anthony Davis is.

Boston Celtics at Oklahoma City Thunder: Russell Westbrook invents a grudge.

Toronto Raptors at Sacramento Kings: Omri Casspi renounces his Israeli citizenship.

11/16/15

Indiana Pacers at Chicago Bulls: The entire Bulls roster is listed as day-to-day.

Boston Celtics at Houston Rockets: Tough back-to-back for this young Celtics team.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies: When Kevin Durant and Russell Westbrook play like this, no one can stop OKC.

Dallas Mavericks at Philadelphia 76ers: Sam Hinkie is mistaken for a young Coach K by an autograph hound.

Los Angeles Lakers at Phoenix Suns: Larry Nance, Jr., pays homage to his father's 1984 Dunk Contest victory.

Portland Trail Blazers at San Antonio Spurs: Wesley Matthews won't admit that he was signed relative to next summer's cap.

11/17/15

Atlanta Hawks at Brooklyn Nets: Dennis Schröder sets the night on fire.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Detroit Pistons: Darrun Hilliard II is mistaken for Damian Lillard's State Farm alter ego.

Toronto Raptors at Golden State Warriors: Harrison Barnes wonders if he's a raptor.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Miami Heat: Dwyane Wade shows these youngsters what the pump fake is all about.

Denver Nuggets at New Orleans Pelicans: Anthony Davis is inducted into the Volleyball Hall of Fame.

Charlotte Hornets at New York Knicks: Nicolas Batum and Kevin Seraphin reminisce about what's her name from Avignon.

Milwaukee Bucks at Washington Wizards: Bradley Beal says he's wounded, not injured.

11/18/15

Sacramento Kings at Atlanta Hawks: Rajon Rondo stops freezing out Ben McLemore.

Dallas Mavericks at Boston Celtics: Devin Harris smokes weed for the first time, fouls out.

Brooklyn Nets at Charlotte Hornets: Brook Lopez accidentally says he's "going down on the ship."

Portland Trail Blazers at Houston Rockets: The Rockets get too flashy.

New Orleans Pelicans at Oklahoma City Thunder: Serge Ibaka and Anthony Davis deliberately avoid each other.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Orlando Magic: Dewayne Dedmon admits it's a stage name.

Indiana Pacers at Philadelphia 76ers: Paul George is worried he might not make the All-Star team.

Chicago Bulls at Phoenix Suns: Can Joakim Noah dance? The debate rages on.

Denver Nuggets at San Antonio Spurs: The Spurs decide to forfeit.

Toronto Raptors at Utah Jazz: Trey Burke contemplates retirement.

11/19/15

Milwaukee Bucks at Cleveland Cavaliers: Tristan Thompson crowd-sources a nickname.

Golden State Warriors at Los Angeles Clippers: Draymond Green says the season is too long; controversy ensues.

Sacramento Kings at Miami Heat: Gerald Green emerges a key player off the bench.

11/20/15

Brooklyn Nets at Boston Celtics: Jared Sullinger hits a three.

Philadelphia 76ers at Charlotte Hornets: Joel Embiid sends a threatening fax.

Utah Jazz at Dallas Mavericks: Gordon Hayward leads the league in scoring for one day.

Phoenix Suns at Denver Nuggets: Markieff Morris wears the last name "Morris" on his jersey in honor of his fallen twin.

Chicago Bulls at Golden State Warriors: Harrison Barnes has a dark side.

Toronto Raptors at Los Angeles Lakers: Roy Hibbert is distracted by his Oscar nomination.

Houston Rockets at Memphis Grizzlies: Come for the game, stay for the commemorative mixtape.

Detroit Pistons at Minnesota Timberwolves: Kevin Garnett gets fragged.

San Antonio Spurs at New Orleans Pelicans: Anthony Davis blocks LaMarcus Aldridge's shot three times in a row.

New York Knicks at Oklahoma City Thunder: The game is canceled due to earthquake.

Los Angeles Clippers at Portland Trail Blazers: Finally, Al-Farouq Aminu takes Noah Vonleh under his wing.

11/21/15

Atlanta Hawks at Cleveland Cavaliers: LeBron James reminds the Hawks of last year's playoffs.

Washington Wizards at Detroit Pistons: Steve Blake krumping revival.

New York Knicks at Houston Rockets: Dwight Howard scores 30 points, has identity crisis.

Milwaukee Bucks at Indiana Pacers: Are the Pacers really a veteran team on the rise?

Philadelphia 76ers at Miami Heat: Justise Winslow gets a much-needed confidence boost.

Sacramento Kings at Orlando Magic: Seth Curry is sick of answering questions about his brother.

Memphis Grizzlies at San Antonio Spurs: Tony Allen brags that his team is "Spurs-proof."

11/22/15

Boston Celtics at Brooklyn Nets: The Celtics coast.

Golden State Warriors at Denver Nuggets: Marreese Speights decides to buy a vowel.

Toronto Raptors at Los Angeles Clippers: Josh Smith and Lance Stephenson declare a truce.

Portland Trail Blazers at Los Angeles Lakers: For the first time in his life, Kobe Bryant experiences doubt.

Phoenix Suns at New Orleans Pelicans: Jrue Holiday and Eric Gordon play like a $25 million backcourt.

Dallas Mavericks at Oklahoma City Thunder: Dirk Nowitzki can't remember his career high in points.

11/23/15

Sacramento Kings at Charlotte Hornets: The Hornets wear throwback Bobcats jerseys.

Orlando Magic at Cleveland Cavaliers: JR Smith banks one in on purpose.

New York Knicks at Miami Heat: Lou Amundson quits Twitter.

Detroit Pistons at Milwaukee Bucks: OJ Mayo wonders about his role.

Philadelphia 76ers at Minnesota Timberwolves: Sixers unveil their revolutionary "player-less basketball."

Phoenix Suns at San Antonio Spurs: In imitation of the NHL's popular outdoor games, this one's played on an abandoned desert highway.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Utah Jazz: The Jazz petition to have the Thunder change divisions.

11/24/15

Boston Celtics at Atlanta Hawks: Marcus Smart arrives.

Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets: Chris Paul fends off rookie sensation Emmanuel Mudiay.

Los Angeles Lakers at Golden State Warriors: For one night, Jason Thompson is the most important Thompson.

Dallas Mavericks at Memphis Grizzlies: Newly minted Civil War buff Matt Barnes makes a splash.

Chicago Bulls at Portland Trail Blazers: Gerald Henderson contemplates his NBA mortality, going on a scoring tear.

Indiana Pacers at Washington Wizards: All systems go for Otto Porter, Jr.

11/25/15

Philadelphia 76ers at Boston Celtics: Robert Covington demands a trade.

Washington Wizards at Charlotte Hornets: Kris Humphries drops his Travis Scott diss track.

Miami Heat at Detroit Pistons: Spencer Dinwiddie continues his strong play. A logjam ensues.

Memphis Grizzlies at Houston Rockets: This one could get ugly.

Utah Jazz at Los Angeles Clippers: A feisty young reporter dubs the Jazz "Length City."

Sacramento Kings at Milwaukee Bucks: The Kings realize they have an unfilled roster spot. Vivek Ranadivé claims it was on purpose.

Atlanta Hawks at Minnesota Timberwolves: The Hawks realize that they have no small forwards.

Brooklyn Nets at Oklahoma City Thunder: Kevin Durant breaks Russell Westbrook's franchise scoring record.

New York Knicks at Orlando Magic: Arron Afflalo declares war on the New York Post.

New Orleans Pelicans at Phoenix Suns: The Pelicans can't handle Phoenix's up-tempo attack.

Dallas Mavericks at San Antonio Spurs: Dirk Nowitzki and Tim Duncan have a tense pregame meal.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Toronto Raptors: Jonas Valanciunas out-Slavs Timofey Mozgov.

11/27/15

Washington Wizards at Boston Celtics: Four Celtics hit double digits in assists.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Charlotte Hornets: LeBron James buys Charlotte Motor Speedway.

San Antonio Spurs at Denver Nuggets: Kawhi Leonard shaves his head.

Philadelphia 76ers at Houston Rockets: Isaiah Canaan Revenge Game.

Chicago Bulls at Indiana Pacers: Myles Turner holds his own.

New Orleans Pelicans at Los Angeles Clippers: Kendrick Perkins loses his motivational touch.

Atlanta Hawks at Memphis Grizzlies: Metro Boomin arranges the national anthem for string quartet.

Miami Heat at New York Knicks: The big city still frightens Hassan Whiteside.

Detroit Pistons at Oklahoma City Thunder: Anthony Tolliver makes more money than Danny Granger.

Milwaukee Bucks at Orlando Magic: John Henson is declared lactose intolerant.

Golden State Warriors at Phoenix Suns: Shaun Livingston tells the press that his knee injury was the best thing that's ever happened to him.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Sacramento Kings: More anti-Semitic abuse hurled at Zach LaVine.

11/28/15

Brooklyn Nets at Cleveland Cavaliers: LeBron James buys the Nets.

Denver Nuggets at Dallas Mavericks: Kevin Garnett goes gray.

Sacramento Kings at Golden State Warriors: DeMarcus Cousins has no problem keeping up with the Warriors.

Los Angeles Lakers at Portland Trail Blazers: Tarik Black re-signs with Rawkus.

Atlanta Hawks at San Antonio Spurs: High-energy forward Jae Crowder overplays his hand.

New Orleans Pelicans at Utah Jazz: Dante Exum rejoices in gardening.

Toronto Raptors at Washington Wizards: Anthony Bennett goes for 40, is no longer worst number one overall pick ever.

11/29/15

Detroit Pistons at Brooklyn Nets: Mikhail Prokhorov auctions off his rare pigeon collection at halftime.

Milwaukee Bucks at Charlotte Hornets: Spencer Hawes catches hell for his Daily Caller piece.

Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Clippers: Gorgui Dieng accidentally goes to a job fair.

Indiana Pacers at Los Angeles Lakers: Not to sound like a broken record, but D'Angelo Russell is really good.

Philadelphia 76ers at Memphis Grizzlies: Jeff Green sees a sports psychologist about his rebounding.

Houston Rockets at New York Knicks: James Harden has one of those proverbial big games at the Garden.

Boston Celtics at Orlando Magic: Perry Jones is not the answer.

Phoenix Suns at Toronto Raptors: Avery Bradley shuts down DeMar DeRozan.

11/30/15

Oklahoma City Thunder at Atlanta Hawks: This is close until Russell Westbrook happens.

San Antonio Spurs at Chicago Bulls: Danny Green slaps Pau Gasol and everyone pretends it didn't happen.

Houston Rockets at Detroit Pistons: Andre Drummond calls Dwight Howard "short."

Portland Trail Blazers at Los Angeles Clippers: Paul Pierce rolls up in a chromed-out hearse.

Boston Celtics at Miami Heat: Micky Arison watches the game from one of those makeshift cocaine submarines.

Denver Nuggets at Milwaukee Bucks: Jason Kidd makes the team watch Fried Green Tomatoes for inspiration.

Dallas Mavericks at Sacramento Kings: The Mavericks ask if they can lease Willie Cauley-Stein.

Golden State Warriors at Utah Jazz: I guess Utah's legit.

DECEMBER

12/1/15

Phoenix Suns at Brooklyn Nets: Eric Bledsoe burns down Target.

Washington Wizards at Cleveland Cavaliers: John Wall spoils Kyrie Irving's second shot at returning from injury.

Orlando Magic at Minnesota Timberwolves: Mario Hezonja gets into it with Nikola Peković over something no American will ever understand.

Memphis Grizzlies at New Orleans Pelicans: The Grizzlies walk to New Orleans for this one.

Los Angeles Lakers at Philadelphia 76ers: Joel Embiid reaches out to Julius Randle, who lies about his plans.

Dallas Mavericks at Portland Trail Blazers: Aminu's Army expands with every Portland home game.

12/2/15

Toronto Raptors at Atlanta Hawks: Tim Hardaway, Jr., becomes the first player ever to miss the Knicks.

Denver Nuggets at Chicago Bulls: Bobby Portis learns from the master.

Golden State Warriors at Charlotte Hornets: Frank Kaminsky struggles with the concept of small ball.

Phoenix Suns at Detroit Pistons: Andre Drummond admits to being a big fan of Alex Len.

New Orleans Pelicans at Houston Rockets: Slim Thug sings the national anthem. Like, actually sings it.

Indiana Pacers at Los Angeles Clippers: Frank Vogel has a lost weekend.

Philadelphia 76ers at New York Knicks: The Sixers are trying not to try and yet somehow try harder than the Knicks.

Milwaukee Bucks at San Antonio Spurs: The Bucks are left wondering what it means when they lead the whole game only to lose in the fourth.

Los Angeles Lakers at Washington Wizards: Kobe Bryant laments that young teams lose on the road, then smirks.

12/3/15

San Antonio Spurs at Memphis Grizzlies: The Spurs decide to have a rivalry.

Oklahoma City Thunder at Miami Heat: Russell Westbrook gets quarantined.

Indiana Pacers at Portland Trail Blazers: Terry Stotts buys a vintage Sega Genesis.

Boston Celtics at Sacramento Kings: Terry Rozier prank calls DeMarcus Cousins's weekly radio show.

Denver Nuggets at Toronto Raptors: The Denver papers refuse to publish this box score.

Orlando Magic at Utah Jazz: Trey Lyles requests the Canadian national anthem.

12/4/15

Los Angeles Lakers at Atlanta Hawks: Metta World Peace has been pretty quiet this season. Until now.

Houston Rockets at Dallas Mavericks: Rick Carlisle cancels his subscription to America's Top Crew Cuts.

Milwaukee Bucks at Detroit Pistons: Giannis Antetokounmpo politely asks if this game could be played "somewhere else."

Cleveland Cavaliers at New Orleans Pelicans: Matthew Dellavedova hits a big three, is promptly canonized.

Brooklyn Nets at New York Knicks: Everyone in New York City is pumped for this one.

Phoenix Suns at Washington Wizards: Joe Biden gets an ice cream headache.

12/5/15

Charlotte Hornets at Chicago Bulls: Taj Gibson buys out the American Apparel store, surprises teammates with gifts.

Sacramento Kings at Houston Rockets: Daryl Morey gives everyone a free shot of his new vodka.

Orlando Magic at Los Angeles Clippers: Jamal Crawford weirds out Aaron Gordon.

Cleveland Cavaliers at Miami Heat: Iman Shumpert gives a tearful interview on an unspecified subject.

New York Knicks at Milwaukee Bucks: Kristaps Porzingis ain't nothing to fuck with.

Portland Trail Blazers at Minnesota Timberwolves: T-Wolves adopt a Spin the Bottle format for their Kiss Cam.

Denver Nuggets at Philadelphia 76ers: Nerlens Noel discovers babka.

Boston Celtics at San Antonio Spurs: Jimmer Fredette: One Night Only.

Golden State Warriors at Toronto Raptors: Leandro Barbosa finds love in the strangest places!

Indiana Pacers at Utah Jazz: Another highlight for Rodney Hood.

12/6/15

Golden State Warriors at Brooklyn Nets: Andre Iguodala strong-arms Andrea Bargnani over popsicle-naming rights.

Los Angeles Lakers at Detroit Pistons: Roy Hibbert has PTSD, Kobe wants some of it for himself "to see if I can."

Phoenix Suns at Memphis Grizzlies: Like a pharmaceutical risen from the dead, Lazeric Jones signs a 10-day contract with the Grizzlies.

Sacramento Kings at Oklahoma City Thunder: Russell Westbrook spends a quarter chilling the fuck out.

Dallas Mavericks at Washington Wizards: Bradley Beal worries about life after basketball.

12/7/15

Phoenix Suns at Chicago Bulls: The old Derrick Rose is back! For one game, maybe, we hope.

Detroit Pistons at Charlotte Hornets: Al Jefferson badly outmaneuvers Andre Drummond.

Washington Wizards at Miami Heat: Goran Dragic wants to be known "for my many accomplishments."

Portland Trail Blazers at Milwaukee Bucks: Giannis Antetokounmpo starts shaving his neck.

Los Angeles Clippers at Minnesota Timberwolves: Andrew Wiggins with a Tracy McGrady-esque finish.

Boston Celtics at New Orleans Pelicans: Eric Gordon gets fined for wearing a half shirt jersey.
